title: How to Make Rhubarb and Hibiscus Sorbet

text: Place the sugar, water and lemon juice into the saucepan. Bring the mixture to boiling point. Add the dried hibiscus flowers to the boiling liquid. Remove from the heat. Cover the saucepan. Set aside to infuse for 20-30 minutes. Strain out the hibiscus flowers. Add the rhubarb pieces to the strained liquid. Cook the rhubarb for 20 to 30 minutes over low heat, or until the rhubarb is tender.  Puree the mixture using a handheld mixer. Puree until fine in consistency. Place in the refrigerator overnight.  The next day, pour the mixture into a sorbet maker and place in the freezer to set.  Finished.
